definition: to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
variant of 燙|烫[tang4]/variant of 趟[tang4]
lit. a full bottle makes no sound; a half-filled bottle sloshes (idiom)/fig. empty vessels make the most noise
pinyin: yi1 ping2 zi5 bu4 xiang3 , ban4 ping2 zi5 huang4 dang5
containing_words.word: 一瓶子不响，半瓶子晃荡

sentences.english: Results will usually be better than if you spend 2 hours lolly-gagging around the gym. But be warned.
sentences.chinese: 而且效果通常比你在健身房晃荡两小时来得好。

sentences.english: Concentrate on those who have bought drinks and are still loitering at the bar.
sentences.chinese: 注意那些已经买了酒可还在吧台前晃荡的人。

sentences.english: Some years I chaos, in short, is displaced, around rock.
sentences.chinese: 我的岁月有些乱，总之，就是颠沛流离，四处晃荡。

sentences.english: You could also wear jewellery such as wire bracelets and some dangling earrings.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以戴些像手镯和晃晃荡荡的耳环之类的饰品。

sentences.english: They were sitting on the dock, feet dangling in the water, Fishing poles in hand.
sentences.chinese: 他们坐在码头上，手里拿着钓鱼竿，脚板在水里晃荡。

sentences.english: The other day, I found three different pleas floating around on the screen.
sentences.chinese: 某天，我又发现三个不同的更新请求在满屏幕的晃荡。

sentences.english: Water was slopping around in the bottom of the boat.
The small boat is rocking on the river.

definition: to swing/to sway/to wobble/to hang around/to hover around
to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
to roll/to wander around/to appear repeatedly
to stroll/to go for a walk
to bounce/to jump/to hop/also variant of 蹦達|蹦达[beng4 da2]
to go sightseeing/to spend one's leisure time wandering around
bored to death (idiom)/bored stiff/overcome with boredom
to rove around/to run around in circles/to walk back and forth
